availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John V. Morton (Hickman County, Kentucky, merchant.)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, merchant. Rutherford County, Tennessee, native. Married to Sarah E. Seat Morton in Gibson County, Tennessee, on April 27, 1853. Father of Oscar G. Morton and Stella J. Morton. Merchant in Gibson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Household owned thirteen enslaved persons in Gibson County in 1850. Merchant in Hickman County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Gibson County, Trenton, p. 273A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Gibson County, Trenton.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 468.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 205B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 424B.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Gibson County, 1844-1853: Marriage Bonds, Loose Records Fa-Pa.
"John V. Morton (1824-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial 60243671, accessed November 6, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/60243671.
